channel.title: Life beyond ours?
channel.description:
EDIT: Please actually read this. I know it's long, but be courteous.
There are planets besides ours, stars besides ours, galaxies besides ours, but is there life besides ours? I'm not talking little insects that crawl around, or plant-like things that grow up then die without moving more than a foot. I'm talking intelligent, communicating species out there other than humans. I mean, not every civilization flourishes off of oxygen. Another galaxy could live off of an abundant source of an element that would be poisonous and instant death to a human. It's unpredicatable. I'm just curious about other peoples' opinions. I mean, we've had civilizations that have died out and then we're still here. How did the Native Indians get in America? Did the evolve, just as the Spanish did across seas? Sure, put a history book in my face. I'll put a science book in yours. Our knowledge of our past is based mainly off of guestimations. So what's your guestimation? I guestimate that there are species even on the stars we see that are 100x smarter, more intelligent, more developed, and happier than we are.

Space, time, and all that exists as a whole is infinite.

item.title: Life beyond ours?
item.description:
@11167 wrote:

[quote=“Zillionair1, post:4, topic:287585”][quote author=Zillionair1 link=topic=380240.msg2858460#msg2858460 date=1247021278]
No. I think the other planets are for us when we figure out how to survive on them.
[/quote][/quote]

Sorry, I’m used to bickering with my Science teacher about this, who knows my side of the story.

My point to be implied was that we only guess, and so we don’t even try (as far as the public knows). So I was agreeing with you, but stating that we are not publically advanced enough to do so.

Read full topic

item.title: Life beyond ours?
item.description:
@11167 wrote:

No. I think the other planets are for us when we figure out how to survive on them. Eventually, we will have to inhabit multiple planets, because our plant is already over populated. If you heard about the first flood, when we were technologicly advanced and then wiped out, I think then we were at several different planets. The 1947 crash, may have been an alien that evolved from us in that time before the floods.

According to the guestimations we rely on, we can’t survive on other planets due to lack of oxygen (how the hell do they know?) And I think that lately with all the UFO sitings, the aliens are getting interested in how such dumb people manage to survive

Read full topic
